Name: Genesis block mined
ShortDescription: Block 0, the genesis block, is established at 18:15:05 GMT.
FullDescription: Block 0, the genesis block, is established at 18:15:05 GMT.

Name: MtGox established
ShortDescription: The MtGox Bitcoin currency exchange market is established
FullDescription: The MtGox Bitcoin currency exchange market is established

Name: BitCoin security breach
ShortDescription: Exploit generates 184 billion Bitcoins
FullDescription: A vulnerability in the Bitcoin system that causes Bitcoins to be improperly verified is discovered and exploited, resulting in the generation of 184 billion Bitcoins.

Name: First mobile Bitcoin transaction
ShortDescription: First mobile Bitcoin transaction
FullDescription: The first portable-to-portable transaction of Bitcoins occurs when ribuck sends doublec 0.42 BTC using Bitcoind.

Name: Silk Road opens for business
ShortDescription: Silk Road opens for business
FullDescription: Silk Road, a Bitcoin marketplace, launches an illicit marketplace for drug deals, called the eBay for drugs.

Name: The Great Bubble of 2011
ShortDescription: The Great Bubble of 2011
FullDescription: In the largest percentage price decrease to-date, the MtGox Bitcon exchange rate plummeted to nearly US$10, just four days after its peak at US$31.91. The incident became known as the Great Bubble of 2011.

Name: Largest ever Bitcoin theft reported
ShortDescription: Largest ever Bitcoin theft reported
FullDescription: Bitcoin Forum member, allinvain, claims that 25,000 BTC were stolen from his wallet. At the time, the exchange rate put the amount close to US$375,000.

Name: Mt Gox Security Breach
ShortDescription: Mt Gox Security Breach
FullDescription: MtGox suffers a significant breach of security that results in fraudulent trading and requires the site to be shut down for seven days. The breach compromises the MtGox database with a leak of the user table that contains user names, email addresses, and password hashes of 60,000 accounts. An admin account was accessed from which sell orders were issued for hundreds of thousands of Bitcoins, which forced the MtGox price down to US$17.51 to US$0.01 per Bitcoin.

Name: MyBitcoin loses 150,000 Bitcoins
ShortDescription: MyBitcoin loses 150,000 Bitcoins
FullDescription: A week after being hacked, a MyBitcoin spokesperson explains how the Bitcoin transaction processor lost over 150,000 Bitcoins, worth over US$2 million at the time.

Name: Bitcoin statrtup incubator launched
ShortDescription: Bitcoin statrtup incubator launched
FullDescription: BoostVC, a Bitcoin startup incubator, is launched by Adam Draper.

Name: Glitch causes halt in transactions
ShortDescription: Glitch causes halt in transactions
FullDescription: A significant glitch that involves two different versions of the Bitcoin software forces a halt in transactions that results in a sharp sell-off and a 23 percent drop in value to US$37. Later that evening, the exchange rate recovered much of its value.

Name: Market cap reaches $1 billion
ShortDescription: Market cap reaches $1 billion
FullDescription: The total Bitcoin market cap passes US$1 billion.

Name: Bitcoin Bubbles
ShortDescription: Bitcoin Bubbles
FullDescription: Bitcoin hits an all-time high of US$266, up from only $13 the year before.

Name: Bitcoin Crashes
ShortDescription: Bitcoin Crashes
FullDescription: Bitcoin Central is hacked, with hackers making away with “a few hundred” Bitcoins that the site’s owners agreed to fully cover.

Name: Coinbase receives $5 million in funding
ShortDescription: Coinbase receives $5 million in funding
FullDescription: Coinbase announces a US$5 million investment from funding that is led by Union Square Ventures, becomes the largest funding of a Bitcoin startup to-date.

Name: MtGox funds seized by Homeland
ShortDescription: MtGox funds seized by Homeland
FullDescription: The Department of Homeland Security shut down the Bitcoin exchange (formerly a Magic the Gathering exchange) Mt. Gox in 2013, which was at the time handling almost 70% of Bitcoin transactions. Mt. Gox declared bankruptcy the following year, amidst reports that some 744,000 bitcoins had been stolen from the site.

Name: Bitcoin ruled currency by Texas judge
ShortDescription: Bitcoin ruled currency by Texas judge
FullDescription: In response to a claim by Trendon Shavers, founder of Texas-based Bitcoin Savings & Trust, that Bitcoins are not real money in an attempt to sidestep SEC charges of misappropriation of funds, federal Magistrate Judge Amos Mazzant of the Eastern District of Texas rules that “Bitcoin is a currency or form of money, and investors wishing to invest in BTCST provided an investment of money.”

Name: Bloomberg gets Bitcoin ticker
ShortDescription: Bloomberg gets Bitcoin ticker
FullDescription: The Bitcoin ticker arrives on the Bloomberg terminal so that Bloomberg employees can track the value of BTC under XBT Currency.

Name: The biggest heist in history
ShortDescription: The biggest heist in history
FullDescription: 96,000 Bitcoins are stolen from Sheep Marketplace, an online drug site, while the internet watches the thief move the funds wallet to wallet.

Name: China's Central Bank bans Bitcoin transactions
ShortDescription: China's Central Bank bans Bitcoin transactions
FullDescription: China’s central bank bars financial institutions from handling Bitcoin transactions, causing a price drop of more than 20 percent to below $1,000.

Name: CitiCoin announced
ShortDescription: Citigroup has built its own digital currency based on bitcoin and the blockchain.
FullDescription: Ken Moore, head of Citi Innovation Labs, confirmed that the bank has been looking at distributed ledger technology, and is discussing the opportunity to create a state-backed digital currency in a number of different countries with governments and regulators for cross-border payments and remittances.

Name: Factom released
ShortDescription: Factom released
FullDescription: Factom, the startup which believes the use cases of the Bitcoin blockchain extend far beyond financial records and into records of all types, has released an early working version of their concept which currently only runs on the Bitcoin testnet.

Name: Ethererum released
ShortDescription: Ethererum released
FullDescription: Ethereum is a public blockchain-based distributed computing platform, featuring smart contract functionality.[1] It provides a decentralized virtual machine, the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), that can execute peer-to-peer contracts using a cryptocurrency called ether.

Name: Blockstream released
ShortDescription: Blockstream announced the release of its Liquid sidechain which could allow for the transfer of assets between the sidechain and the main blockchain.
FullDescription: Blockstream is focused on developing bitcoin applications specifically sidechains, raises $76M to date from investors including Horizons Ventures and Mosaic Ventures.

Name: IBM to Unveils Blockchain IoT Proof-of-Concept
ShortDescription: IBM to Unveils Blockchain IoT Proof-of-Concept
FullDescription: IBM’s planned project, called Adept, utilizes three distinct technologies including the blockchain, TeleHash, and BitTorrent.

Name: NASDAQ Launches Linq, a Private Blockchain-Powered Trading Platform
ShortDescription: NASDAQ Launches Linq, a Private Blockchain-Powered Trading Platform
FullDescription: Nasdaq has continued with its blockchain affair by unveiling its latest blockchain tech initiative – Linq, a platform that enables private companies to trade their shares using the bitcoin-powering technology, even before the companies go public.

Name: 25 Banks Join R3 Initiative
ShortDescription: 26 Banks Join R3 Initiative
FullDescription: The R3 global consortium of financial institutions is now comprised of the majority of the world’s biggest banks looking into the ways in which block chain technology can develop new applications for the global financial industry.

Name: Microsoft Launches Ethereum-Powered Blockchain Platform
ShortDescription: Microsoft Launches Ethereum-Powered Blockchain Platform
FullDescription: Microsoft has confirmed the launch of its previously announced cloud-based blockchain platform. With the reveal, Microsoft now notes the new technology will specifically help financial institutions with tools to experiment with blockchain technology on its Azure platform.

Name: Bitnation Block Chain Notary Services for Estonia
ShortDescription: Bitnation Block Chain Notary Services for Estonia
FullDescription: Bitnation, a governance service that provides block chain IDs and bitcoin debit cards to refugees, has teamed with the government of Estonia to provide public notary services on the block chain, according to the International Business Times. Beginning in December, people utilizing Estonia’s e-residency program will be able to notarize marriages, contracts, birth certificates and more on the block chain. Estonia’s e-residency program allows anyone to use its online identity service, regardless where they live.

Name: SWIFT Launches BlockChain Initiative
ShortDescription: SWIFT Launches BlockChain Initiative
FullDescription: SWIFT has launched a cross-border payments initiative to improve bank customer service by increasing transparency, speed and predictability of payments using the block chain. The project, called the Global Payments Innovation Initiative, will focus on business-to-business payments in early 2016.

Name: Parisian Engineering School Will Certify Diplomas on the Blockchain
ShortDescription: Parisian Engineering School Will Certify Diplomas on the Blockchain
FullDescription: The École Supérieure d’Ingénieurs Léonard de Vinci, a top engineering school in France will soon be issuing diplomas certified by the blockchain. In doing so, the institution will be the first French school to certify diplomas on the blockchain.

Name: JP Morgan CEO: Bitcoin is Going Nowhere
ShortDescription: JP Morgan CEO: Bitcoin is Going Nowhere
FullDescription: Jamie Dimon, JP Morgan CEO, doesn’t see Bitcoin going anywhere, although he does state blockchain technology “is real.”

Name: Bank of America Drawing up 20 More Blockchain Patents
ShortDescription: Bank of America Drawing up 20 More Blockchain Patents
FullDescription: In addition to 15 previously filed blockchain-related patents, Bank of America is now reportedly drafting up another 20 patents that will be submitted to the USPTO later this month - trying to get ahead in the blockchain space as one of the few big financial institutions actively filing patents related to crypto technology.

Name: Factom Lands Smart-City Deal With China
ShortDescription: Factom Lands Smart-City Deal With China
FullDescription: China’s government is working with Factom, a blockchain based record verification and auditing infrastructure company along with consulting firm iSoftStone to plan blockchain based administration projects for smart cities. The plan will include strategies for storage, auditing and verification services.

Name: Blockchain eVoting in Estonia
ShortDescription: Blockchain eVoting in Estonia
FullDescription: Nasdaq and the Republic of Estonia have announced that Estonia's e-Residency platform will be facilitating a blockchain-based e-voting service to allow shareholders of companies listed on Nasdaq's Tallinn Stock Exchange, Estonia's only regulated securities market, to vote in shareholder meetings.

Name: HyperLedger launched
ShortDescription: HyperLedger launched
FullDescription: IBM has thrown its weight in fully backing and pushing distributed ledger or blockchain technology for real world applications, by releasingf 44,000 lines of code, now deemed open-source, to the Linux Foundation’s Hyperledger Project.

Name: Factom to Integrate Blockchain  with Notary Services in China
ShortDescription: Factom to Integrate Blockchain  with Notary Services in China
FullDescription: Factom has announced an initiative with Ancun Zhengxin in China to bring together blockchain or distributed ledger technology with electronic data notarization services in the country.

Name: Airbnb Co-Founder Sees Possible Integration of Blockchain
ShortDescription: Airbnb Co-Founder Sees Possible Integration of Blockchain
FullDescription: Airbnb co-founder and CTO Nathan Blecharczyk has spoken about the possibility of integrating blockchain technology into the company’s engine. The platform’s current method of verification and establishing trust with reputation is through a mixture of official identification scans and social network profiles. In a further nod to embracing technology for an even wider audience –including those who are unbanked – Airbnb could look at innovative microfinance concepts like Mpesa in the future, although such endeavors aren’t pinned down just yet.

Name: Arcade City Uses Blockchain Tech to Take on Uber
ShortDescription: Arcade City Uses Blockchain Tech to Take on Uber
FullDescription: Driver-owned ridesharing startup Arcade City, the developer of an open marketplace where riders connect directly with drivers by leveraging blockchain technology has now launched its mobile application for Apple iOS and Google Android devices.

Name: Microsoft Announces Blockchain Partnership with R3
ShortDescription: Microsoft Announces Blockchain Partnership with R3
FullDescription: Microsoft is now in a partnership with R3CEV, a consortium of the leading banking institutions of the world that is looking to develop real-world blockchain solutions for the current banking and financial services industry.

Name: Australia Calls for Global ISO Blockchain Standards
ShortDescription: Australia Calls for Global ISO Blockchain Standards
FullDescription: Australia’s standards authority, Standards Australia, has asked the International Standards Organisation, commonly known as ISO, to commence work on setting global standards for blockchain technologies.

Name: TransferWise CEO declares Bitcoin is dead
ShortDescription: TransferWise CEO declares Bitcoin is dead
FullDescription: TransferWise has raised nearly $100 million in equity funding with Richard Branson and Andreessen Horowitz among the notable investors. CEO declares Bitcoin dead - there is no traction, no one is using bitcoin. Sentiment was shared by former Bitcoin core developer Mike Hearn.

Name: Gem Launches Blockchain Healthcare Network
ShortDescription: Gem Launches Blockchain Healthcare Network
FullDescription: Gem partners with Philips to develop blockchains that address the trade-off between data availability and data security. For healthcare, this enables hospitals, insurance companies and labs to connect in real-time and share information instantly and seamlessly – without exposing those channels to theft or forgery.

Name: $81 Million Cyberheist Underscores Need for Blockchain Security
ShortDescription: $81 Million Cyberheist Underscores Need for Blockchain Security
FullDescription: Investigators at BAE Systems, a U.K.-based defense contractor, believe  attackers hacked into the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT) financial platform that provides the heart of the global financial system. SWIFT confirmed it was aware of malware attacks on its client software.

Name: Scientific Research on a Blockchain
ShortDescription: Scientific Research on a Blockchain
FullDescription: Dr. Greg Irving, a Clinical Lecturer from the University of Cambridge, recently authored a research project on the potential impact of blockchain technology on scientific research.

Name: MIT Media Lab Uses Blockchain to Issue Academic Certificates
ShortDescription: MIT Media Lab Uses Blockchain to Issue Academic Certificates
FullDescription: Members of the MIT Media Lab have related in a Medium post what they have learned from designing a system for issuing academic certificates using bitcoin blockchain technology.

Name: SAP Joins Blockchain Bandwagon
ShortDescription: SAP Joins Blockchain Bandwagon
FullDescription: SAP, a multi-national enterprise resource planning software provider, is writing specialized software to allow customers to connect blockchains to its Hana Cloud Platform, which provides an online database for adding new functions to their SAP systems, according to Bloomberg.

Name: Industry Leaders Reach Agreement on Blockchain Governance
ShortDescription: Industry Leaders Reach Agreement on Blockchain Governance
FullDescription: Prominent leaders in the blockchain space have formed a new group with the aim of promoting blockchain’s use cases, increasing collaboration within the industry and addressing blockchain governance.

Name: China’s Social Security to Use Blockchain Tech
ShortDescription: China’s Social Security to Use Blockchain Tech
FullDescription: China's National Council for Social Security manages almost $300 billion with a budget increasing yearly by 24.6 percent. Due to blockchain’s ability to cut out middle men, they are hoping to decrease costs and increase efficiency with clearing, settlement, payments and record keeping made easier by blockchain technology.

Name: Synereo’s ‘Blockchain 2.0’ Stack released
ShortDescription: Synereo’s ‘Blockchain 2.0’ Stack released
FullDescription: The Synereo “Technology Stack” provides, for the first time, scalable decentralized computation abilities on an industrial scale. In the near future, it will be possible to deploy fully operational applications on the system, without the applications having to be stored in a centralized location. This capability effectively changes the way the Internet works.

Name: Russian Central Bank Says Instant Blockchain Disruption a “Myth”
ShortDescription: Russian Central Bank Says Instant Blockchain Disruption a “Myth”
FullDescription: The Deputy Chairman of Russia’s central bank has poured cold water on the frenzied buzz surrounding blockchain, opining that the innovation is still years away from being adopted by the banking industry. It would take an additional 3-4 years to study and understand the technology.

Name: Blockfreight Taps Blockchain To Disrupt Global Shipping
ShortDescription: Blockfreight Taps Blockchain To Disrupt Global Shipping
FullDescription: Blockfreight, designed as the first end-to-end blockchain solution for the global cargo shipping industry, has announced its technology and has launched an initial token sale.

Name: Declining Profitability For New Miners Threatens Bitcoin Decentralization
ShortDescription: Declining Profitability For New Miners Threatens Bitcoin Decentralization
FullDescription: The halving of the bitcoin block reward this past July has changed the profitability of new miner entries, a development that could ultimately impact bitcoin’s decentralization.

Name: Goldman Sachs Files Patent for for Blockchain FX Trading
ShortDescription: Goldman Sachs Files Patent for for Blockchain FX Trading
FullDescription:
According to the Goldman Sachs patent, though, there are drawbacks associated with these systems. These systems suffer from significant disadvantages in terms of privacy, because they maintain balances and transaction records in publicly accessible ledgers that are stored on distributed servers.
This means that if a bank blockchain is transparent, it gives competitors the ability to place opposite trades against each other thus reducing the competitive nature of foreign exchange trading. By submitting the patent, Goldman Sachs is aiming to combine the advantages of blockchain with technologies that deliver security, privacy, and comply with regulations.

Name: Bank of England pours scorn on the outlook of blockchain technology
ShortDescription: Bank of England pours scorn on the outlook of blockchain technology
FullDescription: Andrew Hauser, executive director for Banking, Payments and Financial Resilience at the Bank of England (BOE) does not believe that blockchain is going big anytime soon, despite the ever-present interest and investment being poured into researching and developing blockchain applications from companies across a variety of industries.

Name: Singapore Road Tests Future of B2B Blockchain Contracts
ShortDescription: Singapore Road Tests Future of B2B Blockchain Contracts
FullDescription: Singapore is road testing its first B2B contract registered to the Blockchain between two enterprises. While last week’s debut of smart contract between IBM and Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ is private in nature, this Blockchain MOU will be the first B2B contract publically available on the Blockchain for anyone to verify.

Name: Gartner declares Blockchain Over-Hyped
ShortDescription: Gartner declares Blockchain Over-Hyped
FullDescription: Peter Sondergaard, senior vice president for technology at prominent technology research and advisory firm Gartner opined that while distributed ledger technology represents “fascinating area” to keep an eye on, there are too many expectations prophesized with its immediate application in the financial sector."I think it’s being over-hyped right now.

Name: Stanford University to Host Blockchain Conference
ShortDescription: Stanford University to Host Blockchain Conference
FullDescription: Ahead of the Blockchain Protocol Analysis and Security Engineering 2017 conference slated for January 2017, the Cyber Initiative of Stanford University has announced its call for papers from interested presenters. The conference will explore the use of formal methods, empirical analysis, and risk modeling to better understand security and systemic risk in blockchain protocols. It aims to foster multidisciplinary collaboration among practitioners and researchers in blockchain protocols, distributed systems, cryptography, computer security, and risk management.

Name: Bitfury Lightning Network Algorithm ‘Flare’ Addresses Bitcoin Scaling Challenge
ShortDescription: Bitfury Lightning Network Algorithm ‘Flare’ Addresses Bitcoin Scaling Challenge
FullDescription: ACINQ, a French startup that develops bitcoin products, successfully tested the Bitfury Group’s payment routing solution called Flare on the Lightning Network, according to an ACINQ press release. The test bodes well for addressing the bitcoin scaling challenge.

Name: Sydney Stock Exchange Public Blockchain has Successful Prototype
ShortDescription: Sydney Stock Exchange Public Blockchain has Successful Prototype
FullDescription: The Sydney Stock Exchange (SSX) has successfully prototyped its open blockchain ledger for real-time issuance and allocation of equity security, within a month after confirming the project. Following its mid-September confirmation that it is pressing ahead to build an open, public blockchain platform that will reduce settlement times of trades and equities, the Sydney Stock Exchange has now tested its prototype blockchain ledger successfully.

Name: 100% Blockchain for Dubai Government by 2020
ShortDescription: 100% Blockchain for Dubai Government by 2020
FullDescription: The government of Dubai will see all of its documents on a blockchain by the year 2020. The announcement was made via the Dubai Media Office’s official social media account, citing Hamdan bin Mohammed, the hereditary Prince to the crown of Dubai.

Name: IBM Invests $200 Million in Watson IoT Blockchain Development
ShortDescription: IBM Invests $200 Million in Watson IoT Blockchain Development
FullDescription:
IBM has invested $200 million USD in the Watson Internet of Things (IoT) global headquarters in Munich, Germany, including new IoT capabilities related to blockchain.
Efforts to deliver insights from billions of sensors in cars, drones, machines, ball bearings, equipment and even hospitals.The investment is part of a $3 billion USD global outlay to bring Watson cognitive computing to IoT.

Name: China Publishes an Official Blockchain Whitepaper
ShortDescription: China Publishes an Official Blockchain Whitepaper
FullDescription: China’s Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) has published the country’s first official guiding document on blockchain technology and its applications in the country.

Name: R3’s Blockchain Software is Going Open Source
ShortDescription: R3’s Blockchain Software is Going Open Source
FullDescription: R3’s blockchain software Corda, the product of the New York-based startup’s Concord project that aims to develop banking solutions overseen by 70 of the world’s biggest banks participating in the R3-led consortium, will go open source, via the Linux Foundation-led Hyperledger Project.

Name: 12 R3 Member Banks Trial Cross-Border Payments
ShortDescription: 12 R3 Member Banks Trial Cross-Border Payments
FullDescription: Twelve member banks of the R3-led banking blockchain consortium and the New York-based startup have trialed Ripple’s native digital currency token XRP, using the Fintech startup’s blockchain technology.

Name: Overstock to Start Bitcoin Stock Trading
ShortDescription: Overstock Enables Trade of its Shares on its Blockchain Platform
FullDescription: Overstock will allow its stockholders to purchase shares of its preferred stock, including those to be issued and traded exclusively using the bitcoin-based “T0” platform the company developed for trading equities.

Name: ABN AMRO and Dutch University Partner on Blockchain
ShortDescription: ABN AMRO and Dutch University Partner on Blockchain
FullDescription: Delft University of Technology and Dutch banking giant ABN AMRO have partnered in order to develop new, more complex blockchain applications

Name: Myanmar Moves Toward Blockchain Stock Trading
ShortDescription: Myanmar Moves Toward Blockchain Stock Trading
FullDescription: Daiwa Securities Group will help adopt blockchain technology for stock trading in Myanmar with an aim to implement a blockchain-based trading infrastructure for practical use within the next two years.

Name: ZhongAn Launches Blockchain Incubator
ShortDescription: China’s Online Insurer ZhongAn Launches Blockchain and AI Incubator
FullDescription: ZhongAn, an online property and casualty insurance company has announced the creation of an incubator designed to focus on blockchain and artificial intelligence

Name: Nasdaq launching DLT
ShortDescription: Nasdaq launching DLT
FullDescription: Nasdaq launches blockchain-enabled digital ledger technology to enhance the equity management capabilities offered by its Nasdaq Private Market platform

Name: Some firm offers blockchain trading
ShortDescription: Some firm offers blockchain trading
FullDescription: Some company launches a blockchain system for settlement of currency, equity and fixed income trades almost instantaneously through permissioned distributed ledgers

Name: Blockchain for cyber risk
ShortDescription: Blockchain for cyber risk
FullDescription: Deployment of blockchain-based system to reduce cyber risks by offering identity authentication through a visible ledger

Name: First car rental ageny on a blockchain
ShortDescription: First car rental ageny on a blockchain
FullDescription: First car rental ageny uses smart contracts to automatically allow rentals when payment's received and insurance information is confirmed through a blockchain record.

Name: Blockchain crime fighters
ShortDescription: Blockchain crime fighters
FullDescription: A startup that offers a blockchain system to help track down criminals faster is acquired by the FBI

Name: Some blockchain stack breaks from the pack
ShortDescription: Some blockchain stack breaks from the pack
FullDescription: Ethereum, or some blockchain stack, will take the lead and will become an actual business.

Name: First blockchain unicorn
ShortDescription: First blockchain unicorn
FullDescription: First blockchain unicorn

Name: First blockchain IPO
ShortDescription: First blockchain IPO
FullDescription: First blockchain IPO

Name: A bank offers a service to become a "custodian of cryptographic keys".
ShortDescription: A bank offers a service to become a "custodian of cryptographic keys".
FullDescription: A bank offers a service to become a "custodian of cryptographic keys".

Name: Blockchain distribute social welfare
ShortDescription: Blockchain distribute social welfare
FullDescription: Blockchain technology is used to distribute social welfare in some developing nation.

Name: First national election using blockchain technology.
ShortDescription: First national election using blockchain technology.
FullDescription: First national election using blockchain technology.
